TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Yadda Yadda Yadda Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n6m9s4dB5t1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><span><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA):</strong> </span><span>Last week I tried to upgrade the KSP Forums with the new vBulletin 5.1.1 version. Unfortunately, we found some issues that could have made the user and admin experience a little bit ugly, so we decided to roll back and stay with our actual forums. No information loss, btw. I also shut down SpacePort site last Friday since our official mod page now is Curse. I started to implement the marketing project IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working with Miguel and Bob for a couple weeks now and I think itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to be pretty cool. I hope we can be testing it by the end of this week and see what happens next one.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> More tidying of the contracts systems and user interfaces for them. Everything is coming together nicely now. </span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Planning some cool stuff with Max, Rows, Bob and Hugo for next week. Been busy with the polishing of the animation, getting to those little details. And starting to wonder how to rig a rope, that can look believable, and at the same time within the limits of our equipment heh. Also checked out some models and audios that are being done as this is published.</span></p>

<p><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps): </strong><span>Working on some design stuff for a really cool, off the wall and kinda silly thing IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working in with our artistic team thanks to a pretty bright idea from Rowsdower. A small, but fun surprise!</span></p>

<p><strong>Jesus (Chuchito):</strong><span> working with unity to get the KSPM more to the reality, having fun with unity and its limitations.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong> *</span><span>Assisted Alex with some QA on the KSP Forum upgrade to determine whether upgrading was a viable option. Additionally started to put some of the plans for increased QA documentation in motion.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> I’m waiting to hear back from some vendors regarding the grand prize for a big contest that’ll be dropping soon. It’s budgetary stuff. Planning. Yadda yadda yadda. The the last piece of the puzzle before I can get it ready to be announced. It’s a bit of a big idea and I hope you’ll enjoy it.<br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Eduardo (Lalo): </strong><span>Making reports and</span><span> </span><span>checked out audios with Dan.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Rogelio (Roger):</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been polishing lights on the scene and moving some assets in order to make better shots. Polishing lights has been hard because I have to make render tests for every shot and the rendering time is longer than the expected. </span></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-dc9fc608-641d-36ba-f781-782afc72eccd"><span>Hugo (The Intern): </span></strong><span>Polished some of the pieces I made for the game and their implementation. Worked on getting some particle fx right. Also working on the small fun surprise with the guys. </span></p>

A suprise?!

.24 is coming along nicely!

Daniel (danRosas): Planning some cool stuff with Max, Rows, Bob and Hugo for next week. Been busy with the polishing of the animation, getting to those little details. And starting to wonder how to rig a rope, that can look believable, and at the same time within the limits of our equipment heh. Also checked out some models and audios that are being done as this is published.

Don't know exactly what you mean by this but I do have some tree rigging experience if you need some help with your rope.

Dangnabbit guys, that surprise better be nice for all the teasing you're doing!

Glad to hear that everything's doing well! Also... ropes?!
What is Yadda?

What is Yadda?

It's synonymous with Bla, Bla, Bla.

What is Yadda?

Figure of speech.

"Yadda yadda yadda," "Blah blah blah."

What is Yadda?

For reference.

What is Yadda?

yadda is a slang, like Gibberish, Blah, Duh, yackety-yak. it usually means 'this and that' or 'whatever'.
Surprise? Hmm.....
We all sat down, did some code, yadda yadda yadda, 0.24.

Ropes...

Does this mean tethers for EVA kerbals?

One can dream...

Ropes...

Does this mean tethers for EVA kerbals?

One can dream...

I know, right?!

When I saw the words "Rigging" and "Rope" I was like .... Can I help?

I have no idea why Squad would be wanting to get into rigging, but I'm interested.

Perhaps it's time for a rope thread.

Let's knot get into punning.

Surprise? Hmm.....

As Max said, it's fun and it's goofy, but it's small, so don't dream too big here

Anyone else find it a bit depressing that each week these dev notes seem to be less about development and more about the activities surrounding it?

Don't get me wrong, I appreciate the devs making the effort to put these together, but admittedly they're becoming less and less interesting each week. The past couple of ones there's been hardly any info about the game itself.

I know it's not accurate, but it tends to give the impression that development is stalling or that there's a very small percentage of the team working on it when all that's heard is "website...animation...yada yada".

Edited June 4, 2014 by FlowerChild

Hi, FlowerChild. There is a subjective attitude to what can be taken of interest in the devnotes each week, since there's all sorts of business going on, but I understand your want for more info on the development process. While we're sure to mention what we *can* talk about, developmentwise, most of the devs that are missing from this week's devnotes are missing because they were busy working on the next update itself. If you want further insight into things for now, I will point you to HarvesteR's update from last week. Meanwhile, I'll continue to pester the guys to add their thoughts later on.

If you want further insight into things for now, I will point you to HarvesteR's update from last week. Meanwhile, I'll continue to pester the guys to add their thoughts later on.

I hear what you're trying to say man, but there's also the flip side of it that if the devs are really too busy to take a few minutes once a week to write a couple of sentences, then concern for their safety is probably in order

Anyways, I'm not really pointing it out as a request for more info, rather saying that the dev notes might be counterproductive in the impressions they create with the community when they don't really contain any development information. I suspect you guys probably do this to keep the community in the loop as to what's going on in order to build up positive sentiment, so I just wanted to point out that when they're as sparse on info about the game itself as they have been lately, they may wind up having the opposite effect.

I hear what you're trying to say man, but there's also the flip side of it that if the devs are really too busy to take a few minutes once a week to write a couple of sentences, then concern for their safety is probably in order

Anyways, I'm not really pointing it out as a request for more info, rather saying that the dev notes might be counterproductive in the impressions they create with the community when they don't really contain any development information. I suspect you guys probably do this to keep the community in the loop as to what's going on in order to build up positive sentiment, so I just wanted to point out that when they're as sparse on info about the game itself as they have been lately, they may wind up having the opposite effect.

I gather that. I appreciate your constructive opinion on the matter. From my end, it definitely stinks not to include some of the dev info from time to time, but at the end of the day, it's still better that you hear that we're up to overall than not hear from us at all. I'm going to hound the crap out of the rest of the guys to see what's up, regardless. Can't say how much success I'll have because yes they are just that busy, but I'll do what I can.
Wondering what that surprise is. Also looking forward to .24!

I gather that. I appreciate your constructive opinion on the matter. From my end, it definitely stinks not to include some of the dev info from time to time, but at the end of the day, it's still better that you hear that we're up to overall than not hear from us at all. I'm going to hound the crap out of the rest of the guys to see what's up, regardless. Can't say how much success I'll have because yes they are just that busy, but I'll do what I can.

Hehe...fair enough man. I've always enjoyed the dev notes quite a bit, especially back when they were in the KSP Weekly format, but as of late I've noticed that I've been checking for them far less frequently, and when I do I've been winding up feeling disappointed more and more often by the lack of info about the game. The amount of conversation occurring within the threads also appears to have slacked off with time, so I've been getting the impression I may not be alone in that, and that it might be worth pointing out as a potential trend.

Anyways, thanks for taking the time to discuss it. Glad to hear you're on top of it
Im hoping the surprise will be GP2, but I doubt it. Perhaps a new moon of Jool? Tethers for kerbals? Stock clouds? The possibilities...
